result.execSummary:
The defendant Marcus D. Kasper was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Reserve Judge Mawdsley presiding for Branch IV: 
case called at 3:09pm. 
Defendant Marcus D. Kasper in court, in custody, with Attorney Matthew E. Weil.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Sentencing arguments given by counsel.
Mr. Kasper makes a statement. 

On Count #4, the Court sentences Mr. Kasper to:
--serve 6 months in the Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges; to commence forthwith
--57 days credit for time already served given
--the clerk is to enter a civil judgment for unpaid financial obligations ordered by the Court
recess 3:27pm.

Attorney Matthew Weil
Sentencing hearing on revocation at 06-26-2015 03:00 pm
Witness Payment Voucher Report

Case called at 11:23 am [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Marcus Kasper appears in court with Attorney Yelena Zarwell. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Scott Heiman--sworn & testifies
--direct exam by ADA Hall
--State Exh#1-Copy of receipts-offered/received
--cross exam by Atty Zarwell
--redirect exam by ADA Hall
--exam by the Court

Court presents basis, finds that burden of proof has not been met. 
Court orders restitution for the costs of the locks installed by Mr. Heiman - to be paid as condition of probation. Once locks have been installed, Mr. Heiman is to submit the receipts/information to the State so they may submit the information to the Agent.
Recess: 12:12 pm
Restitution hearing on December 12, 2014 at 10:30 am.

Cases 14CF238, 14CF254, 14CF278 & 14CF348 called together at 10:35 am [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Marcus D. Kasper in court, in custody, with Attorney Yelena Olegovna Zarwell. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
14CF348: Service of the Complaint Admitted; Reading Waived; Charge/Penalties recited

14CF278: Court examines the Defendant as to rights, understanding & intent.  
Mr. Kasper waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Arraignment.
State files information; Arraignment:--service of Information admitted, reading waived--maximum penalties recited

Constitutional rights given; plea of "No Contest" entered  on Ct #4-14CF238 & plea of "Guilty" on Count #1-14CF278; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #1-14CF254 & Count #2-14CF238 & Count #2-14CF278
On Motion of the State, the Court dismisses out-right Case 14CF348
ADA Hall submits victim impact statement

On Ct #1-14CF278, the Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 3 years, concurrent, with conditions:
On Ct #4-14CF238, the Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 1 year, concurrent, with conditions:
--AODA Assessment (within 120 days of dispo) & Follow Through with any recommended treatment, per Agent
--To undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--To obtain or make legitimate, honest attempt to obtain employment and/or education program, per Agent
--Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol & non-prescribed controlled substances or illegal drugs
--No acts/threats of violence againsts any persons
--No contact with Scott Heiman or presence at his residence
--No contact with Brandon Severson or presence at any residence where he resides
--To pay costs of $243 (14CF238)
--To pay $200 DNA Surcharge (14CF238)
--To pay costs of $$268 (14CF278)
--To pay $250 DNA Surcharge (14CF278)
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand (14CF278)
--To pay restitution as determined by restitution hearing if any payable to Scott Heiman
--To pay 10% restitution processing fee if probation is ordered following restitution hearing

Days credit for time already served: 76 days - 14CF278 (8/9/14 - today's date)
Days credit for time already served: 1 day - 14CF238
Felony Firearm/Voting Prohibitions Warnings Form Given

[Clerk: MK]
case called at 2:02pm. 
Defendant Marcus D. Kasper appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Yelena Zarwell (PD will appoint counsel).  Public Service Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

Mr. Kasper confirms that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint is accurate.

On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited. 
The Court finds that probable cause exists in the Criminal Complaint. 
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $2,500 signature bond, with conditions:
--no direct or indirect contact with Kevin Droster, Brandon Severson, Scott Heiman, or Kyle Droster
--no presence at 117 S. Oak Street in Lake Mills
--no possession or ingestion of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--no possession of drug paraphernalia
recess 2:11pm. 


NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on 7/23/14 at 2:20pm   (2) Preliminary Hearing, with Co-Defendant #14CF236, on 8/8/14 at 8:30am.
